title: Would World War 3 be as beneficial in the long-term as World War 2 was? - Quora

response.answer_text: First, define WWIII. Some people think WWIII is already underway, and it’s only helping the rich and the powerful. If you’re talking about an all-out war between the U.S. and Russia (fat chance) or China (much more likely), then it would probably be far more destructive than WWII. Just think of all the technological advances we’ve made over the past seventy years and all the weapons that are stockpiled around the world. Of course, it’s possible that such a war could be aborted rather quickly. Maybe China would chicken out after losing a couple ships, or the U.S. might sue for peace if China blows up a few hundred bridges and dams and knocks out some computers. Ironically, I personally think WWIII is just about our only hope. The World is going to H*ll, and I don’t know what else is going to break the power of “Global Elitists.” I just hope we can survive to pick up the pieces. On a side note, how was WWII “beneficial”? Over 50 million people died. It was a lucky break for the U.S., because Europe and Japan were bombed into ruins, destroying economic competitors in the process. But it sure wasn’t good for most countries. And how is the U.S. different from Nazi Germany?
